abstract: New banking regulations now being discussed are not likely to be tough enough, increasing the likelihood of another banking meltdown, an economist warns.
snippet: New banking regulations now being discussed are not likely to be tough enough, increasing the likelihood of another banking meltdown, an economist warns.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: A Fed Governor Wants Tougher Rules

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Banks recovered their self-confidence and influence quickly after the financial crisis. But they may fare worse after JPMorgan Chase’s hedging losses and the Libor scandal.
snippet: Banks recovered their self-confidence and influence quickly after the financial crisis. But they may fare worse after JPMorgan Chase’s hedging losses and the Libor scandal.
lead_paragraph: After the financial crisis, nothing was more surprising than the speed with which the banks regained their self-confidence and their influence, not to mention their haughtiness.

headline.main: Scandals May Cost the Banks Their Clout
headline.print_headline: Scandals May Cost The Banks Their Clout
